Package net.minestom.server.network

Class ConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
net.minestom.server.network.ConnectionManager
public final class ConnectionManager extends Object
Manages the connected clients.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
      Gets the Player linked to a PlayerConnection.
      Parameters:
      connection - the player connection
      Returns:
      the player linked to the connection

    • getOnlinePlayers

      @NotNull public @NotNull Collection<@NotNull Player> getOnlinePlayers()
      Gets all online players.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable collection containing all the online players

    • findPlayer

      @Nullable public @Nullable Player findPlayer(@NotNull @NotNull String username)
      Finds the closest player matching a given username.
      Parameters:
      username - the player username (can be partial)
      Returns:
      the closest match, null if no players are online

    • getPlayer

      @Nullable public @Nullable Player getPlayer(@NotNull @NotNull String username)
      Gets the first player which validate String.equalsIgnoreCase(String).

      This can cause issue if two or more players have the same username.

      Parameters:
      username - the player username (ignoreCase)
      Returns:
      the first player who validate the username condition, null if none was found

    • getPlayer

      @Nullable public @Nullable Player getPlayer(@NotNull @NotNull UUID uuid)
      Gets the first player which validate UUID.equals(Object).

      This can cause issue if two or more players have the same UUID.

      Parameters:
      uuid - the player UUID
      Returns:
      the first player who validate the UUID condition, null if none was found

    • setUuidProvider

      public void setUuidProvider(@Nullable @Nullable UuidProvider uuidProvider)
      Changes how UUID are attributed to players.

      Shouldn't be override if already defined.

      Be aware that it is possible for an UUID provider to be ignored, for example in the case of a proxy (eg: velocity).

      Parameters:
      uuidProvider - the new player connection uuid provider, setting it to null would apply a random UUID for each player connection
      See Also:
      • getPlayerConnectionUuid(PlayerConnection, String)

    • getPlayerConnectionUuid

      @NotNull public @NotNull UUID getPlayerConnectionUuid(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerConnection playerConnection, @NotNull @NotNull String username)
      Computes the UUID of the specified connection. Used in LoginStartPacket in order to give the player the right UUID.
      Parameters:
      playerConnection - the player connection
      username - the username given by the connection
      Returns:
      the uuid based on playerConnection return a random UUID if no UUID provider is defined see setUuidProvider(UuidProvider)

    • setPlayerProvider

      public void setPlayerProvider(@Nullable @Nullable PlayerProvider playerProvider)
      Changes the Player provider, to change which object to link to him.
      Parameters:
      playerProvider - the new PlayerProvider, can be set to null to apply the default provider

    • getPlayerProvider

      @NotNull public @NotNull PlayerProvider getPlayerProvider()
      Retrieves the current PlayerProvider, can be the default one if none is defined.
      Returns:
      the current PlayerProvider

    • registerPlayer

      public void registerPlayer(@NotNull @NotNull Player player)

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
      Removes a Player from the players list.

      Used during disconnection, you shouldn't have to do it manually.

      Parameters:
      connection - the player connection
      See Also:
      • to properly disconnect a player

    • startPlayState

      public CompletableFuture<Void> startPlayState(@NotNull @NotNull Player player, boolean register)
      Calls the player initialization callbacks and the event AsyncPlayerPreLoginEvent.

      Sends a LoginSuccessPacket if successful (not kicked) and change the connection state to ConnectionState.PLAY.

      Parameters:
      player - the player
      register - true to register the newly created player in ConnectionManager lists

    • startPlayState

      @NotNull public @NotNull Player startPlayState(@NotNull @NotNull PlayerConnection connection, @NotNull @NotNull UUID uuid, @NotNull @NotNull String username, boolean register)
      Creates a Player using the defined PlayerProvider and execute startPlayState(Player, boolean).
      Returns:
      the newly created player object
      See Also:
      • startPlayState(Player, boolean)

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shutdowns the connection manager by kicking all the currently connected players.

    • updateWaitingPlayers

      public void updateWaitingPlayers()
      Connects waiting players.

    • handleKeepAlive

      public void handleKeepAlive(long tickStart)
      Updates keep alive by checking the last keep alive packet and send a new one if needed.
      Parameters:
      tickStart - the time of the update in milliseconds, forwarded to the packet
